author: Special Correspondent
text:
A leading player in logistics and warehousing sector and Hyderabad-based NDR group has opened its first multi logistics freight terminal near Ahmedabad on Wednesday.

Minister of State for Railways Manoj Sinha inaugurated the new facility spread over 95 acres having three rail sidings capable of handling both containerised and bulk cargo with capacity to handle around 125 trains a month. This will be the NDR group’s second such facility to be rolled out after Hyderabad. Third freight terminal is expected to be commissioned in Panipat in the first quarter of 2016. Two more terminals are being built in Bangalore and Chennai.

“This is a big infrastructure project in logistics and transportation sector in Gujarat. It will create local job opportunities besides contributing to the State’s revenue,” Mr. Sinha said.
title: NDR group opens freight terminal in Gujarat
